Package fi.tuni.tiko

Class MySkin

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin
fi.tuni.tiko.MySkin
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
public class MySkin
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin
The MySkin class holds all textures, fonts and UI styles for the game. The class is used to create a static object that everything in the game refers to when something visual is needed.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin

    com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin.TintedDrawable

  • Constructor Details

    • MySkin

      public MySkin()
      Creates the skin. Adds textures, fonts and UI styles.

  • Method Details

    • addTextures

      public void addTextures()
      Adds textures to the skin. Gives the textures names that are used when getting them from the skin.

    • addFonts

      public void addFonts()
      Adds fonts to the skin. Gives the fonts names that are used when getting them from the skin.

    • createStyles

      public void createStyles()
      Adds text and button styles to the skin. Gives the styles names that are used when getting them from the skin.

    • getPath

      public java.lang.String getPath​(java.lang.String texture)
      Returns the path to a texture file based on a String Adds the appropriate pixel density folder and a .png suffix to the String.
      Parameters:
      texture - which the path is going to go to
      Returns:
      path to the texture file

    • getPixelDensity

      public java.lang.String getPixelDensity()
      Returns the pixel density of the screen. This method uses getDensity() method to determine screen pixel density and returns the correct folder to which the images in the project are being used from.
      Returns:
      returns a string that is used to choose right folder for images

    • createFont

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont createFont​(java.lang.String nameOfFont, float size, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
      createFont creates and returns a BitmapFont to be used This method uses FreeTypeFont to create a BitmapFont from an existing font file in the project font folder.
      Parameters:
      nameOfFont - name of the font file
      size - what size the font will be
      color - what color the font will be
      Returns:
      returns a BitmapFont
